meanings.definition: The amount of light or other radiation reflected by a surface.
meanings.sent1: The reflectance of the mirror made it perfect for checking your appearance.
meanings.sent2: The reflectance of the moonlight off the lake was mesmerizing.
meanings.sent3: The reflectance of the disco ball made the dance floor sparkle like stars.
meanings.sent4: Her smile had a reflectance that brightened up the room.
meanings.sent5: The reflectance of the snow made everything seem brighter and more magical.

meanings.definition: The property of reflecting light or radiation.
meanings.sent1: The shiny surface had high reflectance, bouncing light in all directions.
meanings.sent2: The reflectance of the glass made it difficult to see through.
meanings.sent3: The reflectance of the car's paint job made it look like a mirror on wheels.
meanings.sent4: The reflectance of the water created a beautiful shimmering effect.
meanings.sent5: The reflectance of the diamond was so intense, it sparkled like a star.

meanings.definition: The act of reflecting or being reflected.
meanings.sent1: The reflectance of the sound off the canyon walls was eerie.
meanings.sent2: The reflectance of her thoughts in her journal helped her gain clarity.
meanings.sent3: The reflectance of the light off the disco ball made everyone start dancing.
meanings.sent4: The reflectance of his actions on others was clear in their reactions.
meanings.sent5: The reflectance of the sun off the water blinded him temporarily.
